requirement_text:
As a UMD employee, I want to see a real-time simulation of the current traffic situation of Wonderland, so that I can take more informed decisions
As a UMD employee, I want an up-to-date map of the streets of Wonderland (including different road types and obstacles), so that I have an accurate background for the traffic simulator
As a UMD employee, I want to see the current traffic on the map (gathered from the sensors in Wonderland), so that I the current situation including busy areas and congestions
As a UMD employee, I want to be able to see a heat map of the traffic, so that I can quickly see how the crowdedness is spread in Wonderland at the moment
As a UMD employee, I want to see environmental measures (taken at points in the city), real-time on the map, so that I know how the current traffic situation is affecting the environment
As a UMD employee, I want to see the overall real-time co2 emissions, so that I know how harmful the traffic situation is to the environment
As a UMD employee, I want to see the real-time level of noise per measure point in the map, so that I can see if the noise levels do not exceed the legal limits
As a UMD employee, I want to see the real-time overall level of air pollution, so that I know how harmful the traffic situation is to the environment
As a UMD employee, I want to see the real-time levels of air pollution per measure point in the map, so that I can see it when a certain area is getting too polluted
As a UMD employee, I want all historical data to be saved, so that I am be able to create meaningful insights about this data at a later moment
As a UMD employee, I want to save the simulator data (map, traffic and heatmap) of every moment coupled to that specific time, so that I can look into them at a later moment
As a UMD employee, I want to save the environmental measures of every moment coupled to that specific time, so that I can look into them at a later moment
As a UMD employee, I want to be able to compare historical traffic data, so that I can use the data to create meaningful analyses
As a UMD employee, I want to be able to select a specific period of time to see the “data” from
As a UMD employee, I want to be able to see compare the data from 2 different times next to each other, so that I can compare the 2 situations with each other
As a UMD employee, I want to use historic data to compare multiple situations to compare the results of 2 different solutions that we have built
As a UMD employee, I want to be able to perform repeatable analysis for situations that are similar, so that the workflow is accelerated
As a UMD employee, I want to be able to make predictions about future traffic situations based on similar situations in the past, so that I can take more informed decisions
As a UMD employee, I want to know when an area is expected to be too crowded, so that i can work on a solution to avoid the problem
As a UMD employee, I want to make predictions about the consequences of changing the urban planning of Wonderland, so that I can rely on data when making a decision
As a UMD employee, I want to see the credibility of the prediction simulator, so that I know how much I can rely on the data of the system
As a UMD employee, I want to compare the predicted environmental levels of the simulator to the actual levels measured by the sensors
As a UMD employee, I want the systems to be easy to use, so that I can quickly understand all the functions in the system
As a UMD employee, I want to be able to independently add more data sources later, so that I can keep up to date with the most complete data
As a UMD employee, when the measurements of more sensors become available, I want to be add them to the map, so that my simulator is as accurate as possible
As a UMD employee, when new sources of data become available, I want to use them, so that my simulator is as accurate as possible
As a UMD employee, I want the system to always be available, so that I can access it whenever I need
As a UMD employee, I want to be able to access the system 24/7, so that I can work flexible shifts
As a UMD employee, I want the system to start up within 2 minutes, so that I can go to action fast when it is required
As a UMD employee, I want a platform that can be operated independently by people in the department, so that I don’t have to ask an expert
As a UMD employee, I want the software to be able to reach from remote computers , so that my employees can work from home
As a UMD employee, I want to be able to take snapshots of specific days, or parts of the day, so that I can execute simulations against those scenarios.

use_cases.name: View Traffic Maps
use_cases.description: Display real-time traffic simulations and current traffic conditions on an up-to-date street map with heat maps of congestion.

user_stories.original_sentence: As a UMD employee, I want to see a real-time simulation of the current traffic situation of Wonderland so that I can take more informed decisions.
As a UMD employee, I want to have an up-to-date map of the streets of Wonderland, including different road types and obstacles, so that I have an accurate background for the traffic simulator.
As a UMD employee, I want to see the current traffic on the map, gathered from the sensors in Wonderland, so that I know the current situation including busy areas and congestions.
As a UMD employee, I want to be able to see a heat map of the traffic so that I can quickly see how the crowdedness is spread in Wonderland at the moment.

use_cases.name: View Environmental Data
use_cases.description: Display real-time environmental measures, including CO2 emissions, air pollution, and noise levels, on the map and in aggregate.

user_stories.action: view real-time environmental measures on map
user_stories.original_sentence: As a UMD employee, I want to see environmental measures taken at points in the city in real time on the map so that I know how the current traffic situation is affecting the environment.
As a UMD employee, I want to see the overall real-time CO2 emissions so that I know how harmful the traffic situation is to the environment.

user_stories.action: view real-time noise levels on map
user_stories.original_sentence: As a UMD employee, I want to see the real-time level of noise per measurement point on the map so that I can see if the noise levels exceed the legal limits.
As a UMD employee, I want to see the real-time overall level of air pollution so that I know how harmful the traffic situation is to the environment.

user_stories.action: view real-time air pollution levels on map
user_stories.original_sentence: As a UMD employee, I want to see the real-time levels of air pollution per measurement point on the map so that I can see when a certain area is getting too polluted.

use_cases.name: Predict Traffic Impact
use_cases.description: Generate predictions of future traffic situations and the effects of urban planning changes, including detection of overcrowded areas.

user_stories.original_sentence: As a UMD employee, I want to be able to make predictions about future traffic situations based on similar situations in the past so that I can take more informed decisions.
As a UMD employee, I want to know when an area is expected to be too crowded so that I can work on a solution to avoid the problem.

user_stories.action: predict consequences of urban planning changes
user_stories.original_sentence: As a UMD employee, I want to make predictions about the consequences of changing the urban planning of Wonderland so that I can rely on data when making a decision.

use_cases.name: Assess Prediction Accuracy
use_cases.description: Evaluate the credibility of the prediction simulator by comparing predicted environmental levels with actual sensor measurements.

user_stories.original_sentence: As a UMD employee, I want to see the credibility of the prediction simulator so that I know how much I can rely on the data of the system.

user_stories.action: compare predicted and actual environmental levels
user_stories.original_sentence: As a UMD employee, I want to compare the predicted environmental levels of the simulator to the actual levels measured by the sensors so that I can assess the accuracy of the predictions.

use_cases.name: Capture Scenario Snapshots
use_cases.description: Create and store snapshots of specific time periods or days as scenarios for later simulation and analysis.

user_stories.original_sentence: As a UMD employee, I want to be able to take snapshots of specific days or parts of the day so that I can execute simulations against those scenarios.

use_cases.name: Store Historical Data
use_cases.description: Persist historical traffic, simulation, and environmental measurement data for later retrieval and analysis.

user_stories.original_sentence: As a UMD employee, I want all historical data to be saved so that I am able to create meaningful insights about this data at a later moment.
As a UMD employee, I want to save the simulator data, including the map, traffic, and heat map, of every moment coupled to that specific time so that I can look into it at a later moment.
As a UMD employee, I want to save the environmental measures of every moment coupled to that specific time so that I can look into them at a later moment.

use_cases.name: Analyze Historical Data
use_cases.description: Select time periods and compare traffic and environmental data from different moments to perform repeatable analyses of past situations.

user_stories.original_sentence: As a UMD employee, I want to be able to compare historical traffic data so that I can use the data to create meaningful analyses.
As a UMD employee, I want to be able to select a specific period of time to see the data from so that I can focus on the relevant time frame.
As a UMD employee, I want to be able to compare the data from two different times next to each other so that I can compare the two situations with each other.

user_stories.action: compare multiple situations using historical data
user_stories.original_sentence: As a UMD employee, I want to use historical data to compare multiple situations so that I can compare the results of two different solutions that we have built.

user_stories.action: perform repeatable analysis for similar situations
user_stories.original_sentence: As a UMD employee, I want to be able to perform repeatable analysis for situations that are similar so that the workflow is accelerated.

use_cases.name: Access System
use_cases.description: Provide users with easy, reliable, and remote access to the system at all times across supported platforms.

user_stories.original_sentence: As a UMD employee, I want the systems to be easy to use so that I can quickly understand all the functions in the system.
As a UMD employee, I want the system to always be available so that I can access it whenever I need.
As a UMD employee, I want to be able to access the system 24/7 so that I can work flexible shifts.
As a UMD employee, I want the system to start up within two minutes so that I can go into action fast when it is required.
As a UMD employee, I want a platform that can be operated independently by people in the department so that I don’t have to ask an expert.
As a UMD employee, I want the software to be reachable from remote computers so that my employees can work from home.

use_cases.name: Manage Data Sources
use_cases.description: Add and maintain data sources and sensor measurements used by the simulator to keep maps and analyses up to date.

user_stories.original_sentence: As a UMD employee, I want to be able to independently add more data sources later so that I can keep up to date with the most complete data.
As a UMD employee, I want to be able to add measurements from more sensors to the map when they become available so that my simulator is as accurate as possible.
As a UMD employee, I want to use new sources of data when they become available so that my simulator is as accurate as possible.
